verses.verse: (A Prayer <S%H8605><s%> of the Afflicted, when he is faint, and pours out his complaint) (before the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>) Hear <S%H8085><s%> my prayer, O Lord! And let my cry <S%H7775><s%> for help <S%H7775><s%> come <S%H935><s%> to Thee.

Do not hide <S%H5641><s%> Thy face <S%H6440><s%> from me in the day <S%H3117><s%> of my distress; <S%H9496><s%> Incline <S%H5186><s%> Thine ear <S%H241><s%> to me; In the day <S%H3117><s%> when I call <S%H7121><s%> answer <S%H6030><s%> me quickly. <S%H4118><s%>
For my days <S%H3117><s%> have been <S%H3615><s%> consumed <S%H3615><s%> in smoke, <S%H6227><s%> And my bones <S%H6106><s%> have been scorched <S%H2787><s%> like a hearth. <S%H4168><s%>

My heart <S%H3820><s%> has been smitten <S%H5221><s%> like grass <S%H6212><s%> and has withered <S%H3001><s%> away, Indeed, <S%H3588><s%> I forget <S%H7911><s%> to eat <S%H398><s%> my bread. <S%H3899><s%>
Because <S%H4480><s%> of the loudness <S%H6963><s%> of my groaning <S%H585><s%> My bones <S%H6106><s%> cling <S%H1692><s%> to my flesh. <S%H1320><s%>
I resemble <S%H1819><s%> a pelican <S%H6893><s%> of the wilderness; <S%H4057><s%> I have become <S%H1961><s%> like an owl <S%H9205><s%> of the waste <S%H2723><s%> places. <S%H2723><s%>
I lie <S%H8245><s%> awake, <S%H8245><s%> I have become <S%H1961><s%> like a lonely <S%H909><s%> bird <S%H6833><s%> on a housetop. <S%H1406><s%>
My enemies <S%H340><s%> have reproached <S%H2778><s%> me all <S%H3605><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> long; Those who deride <S%H1984><s%> me have used <S%H7650><s%> my [name] as a curse. <S%H7650><s%>
For I have eaten <S%H398><s%> ashes <S%H665><s%> like bread, <S%H3899><s%> And mingled <S%H4537><s%> my drink <S%H8250><s%> with weeping, <S%H1065><s%>
Because <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6440><s%> of Thine indignation <S%H2195><s%> and Thy wrath; <S%H7110><s%> For Thou hast lifted <S%H5375><s%> me up and cast <S%H7993><s%> me away. <S%H7993><s%>
My days <S%H3117><s%> are like a lengthened <S%H5186><s%> shadow; <S%H6738><s%> And I wither <S%H3001><s%> away like grass. <S%H6212><s%>
But Thou, O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> dost abide <S%H3427><s%> forever; <S%H5769><s%> And Thy name <S%H2143><s%> to all <S%H1755><s%> generations. <S%H1755><s%>

Thou wilt arise <S%H6965><s%> [and] have <S%H7355><s%> compassion <S%H7355><s%> on Zion; <S%H6726><s%> For it is time <S%H6256><s%> to be gracious <S%H2603><s%> to her, For the appointed <S%H4150><s%> time <S%H4150><s%> has come. <S%H935><s%>
Surely <S%H3588><s%> Thy servants <S%H5650><s%> find <S%H7521><s%> pleasure <S%H7521><s%> in her stones, <S%H68><s%> And feel <S%H2603><s%> pity <S%H2603><s%> for her dust. <S%H6083><s%>
So the nations <S%H1471><s%> will fear <S%H3372><s%> the name <S%H8034><s%> of the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> And all <S%H3605><s%> the kings <S%H4428><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%> Thy glory. <S%H9202><s%>
For the Lord <S%H3068><s%> has built <S%H1129><s%> up Zion; <S%H6726><s%> He has appeared <S%H7200><s%> in His glory. <S%H9202><s%>
He has regarded <S%H6437><s%> the prayer <S%H8605><s%> of the destitute, <S%H6199><s%> And has not despised <S%H959><s%> their prayer. <S%H8605><s%>

This <S%H384><s%> will be written <S%H3789><s%> for the generation <S%H1755><s%> to come; <S%H314><s%> That a people <S%H5971><s%> yet to be created <S%H1254><s%> may praise <S%H1984><s%> the Lord. <S%H3050><s%>
For He looked <S%H8259><s%> down <S%H8259><s%> from His holy <S%H6944><s%> height; <S%H4791><s%> From heaven <S%H8064><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> gazed <S%H5027><s%> upon the earth, <S%H776><s%>

To hear <S%H8085><s%> the groaning <S%H603><s%> of the prisoner; <S%H615><s%> To set <S%H6605><s%> free <S%H6605><s%> those <S%H1121><s%> who <S%H1121><s%> were doomed <S%H1121><s%> to death; <S%H8546><s%>
That [men] may tell <S%H5608><s%> of the name <S%H8034><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> in Zion, <S%H6726><s%> And His praise <S%H8416><s%> in Jerusalem; <S%H3389><s%>
When the peoples <S%H5971><s%> are gathered <S%H6908><s%> together, <S%H9191><s%> And the kingdoms, <S%H4467><s%> to serve <S%H5647><s%> the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>
He has weakened <S%H6031><s%> my strength <S%H3581><s%> in the way; <S%H1870><s%> He has shortened <S%H9527><s%> my days. <S%H3117><s%>

I say, <S%H559><s%> "O my God, <S%H410><s%> do not take <S%H5927><s%> me away <S%H5927><s%> in the midst <S%H2677><s%> of my days, <S%H3117><s%> Thy years <S%H8141><s%> are throughout all <S%H1755><s%> generations. <S%H1755><s%>
"Of old <S%H6440><s%> Thou didst found <S%H3245><s%> the earth; <S%H776><s%> And the heavens <S%H8064><s%> are the work <S%H4639><s%> of Thy hands. <S%H3027><s%>

"Even they will perish, but Thou dost endure; <S%H6><s%> And all <S%H5975><s%> of them will wear <S%H3605><s%> out like a garment; <S%H1086><s%> Like clothing <S%H899><s%> Thou wilt change <S%H3830><s%> them, and they will be changed. <S%H2498><s%>
"But Thou art the same, <S%H1931><s%> And Thy years <S%H8141><s%> will not come <S%H8552><s%> to an end. <S%H8552><s%>
"The children <S%H1121><s%> of Thy servants <S%H5650><s%> will continue, <S%H7931><s%> And their descendants <S%H2233><s%> will be established <S%H3559><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Thee."
